entry.et: Middle English beste, from Anglo-French, from Latin bestia

def.dt: :a four-footed mammal as distinguished from a human being, a lower vertebrate, and an invertebrate
:a lower animal as distinguished from a human being
:an animal as distinguished from a plant
:something formidably difficult to control or deal with
:a poem with epic conventions in which animals speak and act like human beings
:a usually didactic prose or verse fable in which animals speak and act like human beings
:an animal employed to carry heavy loads or to perform other heavy work (as pulling a plow)
